result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J. Suchomel

defendant.name: Suchomel, Andrew J.
defendant.address: 1790 Strongs Ave Lower, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard today are: 15CF8 & 15CF72
11:20 am. Court calls case.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney Sheets concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF8
Ct 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant Guilty on Ct 1 in 15CF8.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
Ct 2 in 15CF8 & 15CF72 are DRI.

Court proceeds without PSI.
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs regarding sentencing recommendation and makes additional sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court asks the Defendant if he wants to make any statements.

BY THE COURT:
15CF8
Ct 1:
120 days jail 
Commence within 60 days from today. Get jail start date today at the Sheriff's dept.
Huber for work
May serve last 60 days on electronic monitoring provided meets Sheriff's requirements
Pay costs 60 days from today
1 day jail credit
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J. Suchomel in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived.
Bond is continued.
15CF8 to following with this case as a status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  Atty Sheets in court for the Defendant.
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Sheets indicates this is a special appearance. Atty Sheets is attorney of record in 15CF8.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 3-2-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
